page.title: 20STOCKPORT TOWN HALL
page.content: The{Renaissance style}building at the centre of the borough on Wellington Rd. South replaced the Court House as the principal municipal building at the beginning of the century. Its foundation stone was laid on 15.10.04 and the top stone of the tower placed in position on 30.01.07. It has an imposing frontage of some 70m with a height above pavement level of 40m. There are four main entrances with the public entrance on Edward St. The principal entrance is made in Italian Marble and its double staircase is of Sicilian Marble. The{Council Chamber is an imposing 15m long, 10m wide and 12m high with a vaulted ceiling and domed centre. It has seating room for 66 members and a gallery with room for 60. The walls of the chamber are panelled wainscot oak carved in the style of Grindley Gibbons.
